definition: to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]

sentences.english: Our fur-clad descendents will be crouched over fires.
sentences.chinese: 我们的子孙将穿裘裹皮，蜷缩在火堆旁。

sentences.english: She crouched low like a fawning dog.
sentences.chinese: 她蜷缩在地上，象只摇尾乞怜的狗。

sentences.english: They huddled inside the storm door—two children in ragged outgrown coats.
sentences.chinese: 他们蜷缩在风门里面，是两个衣衫褴褛的孩子。

sentences.english: George was curled up on the floor, practically in tears.
sentences.chinese: 乔治蜷缩在地板上，差不多是哭了出来。

sentences.english: I just want to curl up with my husband and dog.
sentences.chinese: 我只想蜷缩在床上和我的丈夫和狗一起入眠。

sentences.english: When we came in we saw her doubling up on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 我们进来时看见她蜷缩在沙发上。

sentences.english: Or curling up with a cup of eggnog.
sentences.chinese: 或是为了蜷缩着喝一杯蛋酒。

sentences.english: The incinerated body still lay curled in its wooden bed of cinders.
sentences.chinese: 那具未曾烧尽的尸体还蜷缩在木床的余烬里。

sentences.english: My foot struck her, cowering in a corner of the room.
sentences.chinese: 我的脚步声碰到了她，蜷缩在屋子的角落里。

sentences.english: Never scrunch up or grip the floor with your toes in any of the standing poses.
sentences.chinese: 在任何站姿体式里都不要用脚蜷缩或者紧抠地板。

sentences.english: Even makes a joke of how round Rima was when she curl into a ball.
sentences.chinese: 即使只是一个笑话，还是令她蜷缩成一个球。

sentences.english: There is something really relaxing about sitting down or curling up with a good book.
sentences.chinese: 坐下来或者蜷缩着阅读好书真是一件放松的事。

sentences.english: Senile as he is, he crouches in some ragged pieces of cloth.
sentences.chinese: 因为他是老年，他蜷缩在一些衣衫褴褛的布片。

sentences.english: No longer forces the Marksman to crouch and stop moving when used.
sentences.chinese: 不再迫使射手蜷缩在一起，并停止移动时使用。

sentences.english: He is a stooped figure with a pale and puffy face, hunched in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 他背已驼了，面孔苍白浮肿，蜷缩着身子坐在椅子上。

definition: to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)
to curl up/to lie with knees drawn up/to huddle up
to curl up shivering (from cold)/timid and trembling (in fear)/to shrink/to cower
to sleep soundly/to fall into a deep sleep
to curl up/to lie curled up
